     105                 :            : static constexpr auto GETDATA_TX_INTERVAL{60s};
     106                 :            : /** Limit to avoid sending big packets. Not used in processing incoming GETDATA for compatibility */

     114                 :            : static const unsigned int MAX_HEADERS_RESULTS = 2000;

     122                 :            :  *  degree of disordering of blocks on disk (which make reindexing and pruning harder). We'll probably

     311                 :            :     std::unique_ptr<CRollingBloomFilter> m_addr_known;
     312                 :            :     /** Whether we are participating in address relay with this connection.
     313                 :            :      *
     314                 :            :      *  We set this bool to true for outbound peers (other than
     315                 :            :      *  block-relay-only connections), or when an inbound peer sends us an
     316                 :            :      *  address related message (ADDR, ADDRV2, GETADDR).
     317                 :            :      *
     318                 :            :      *  We use this bool to decide whether a peer is eligible for gossiping
     319                 :            :      *  addr messages. This avoids relaying to peers that are unlikely to
     320                 :            :      *  forward them, effectively blackholing self announcements. Reasons
     321                 :            :      *  peers might support addr relay on the link include that they connected
     322                 :            :      *  to us as a block-relay-only peer or they are a light client.
     323                 :            :      *
     324                 :            :      *  This field must correlate with whether m_addr_known has been
     325                 :            :      *  initialized.*/

     353                 :            :     /** Protects m_getdata_requests **/
     354                 :            :     Mutex m_getdata_requests_mutex;
     355                 :            :     /** Work queue of items requested by this peer **/
     356                 :            :     std::deque<CInv> m_getdata_requests GUARDED_BY(m_getdata_requests_mutex);
     357                 :            : 
     358         [ #  # ]:          0 :     Peer(NodeId id)
     359                 :          0 :         : m_id{id}
     360                 :          0 :     {}
     361                 :            : 
     362                 :            : private:
     363                 :            :     Mutex m_tx_relay_mutex;
     364                 :            : 
     365                 :            :     /** Transaction relay data. Will be a nullptr if we're not relaying
     366                 :            :      *  transactions with this peer (e.g. if it's a block-relay-only peer or
     367                 :            :      *  the peer has sent us fRelay=false with bloom filters disabled). */
     368                 :            :     std::unique_ptr<TxRelay> m_tx_relay GUARDED_BY(m_tx_relay_mutex);
     369                 :            : };
     370                 :            : 
     371                 :            : using PeerRef = std::shared_ptr<Peer>;
     372                 :            : 
     373                 :            : /**
     374                 :            :  * Maintain validation-specific state about nodes, protected by cs_main, instead
     375                 :            :  * by CNode's own locks. This simplifies asynchronous operation, where
     376                 :            :  * processing of incoming data is done after the ProcessMessage call returns,
     377                 :            :  * and we're no longer holding the node's locks.
     378                 :            :  */
     379                 :          0 : struct CNodeState {
     380                 :            :     //! The best known block we know this peer has announced.
     381                 :          0 :     const CBlockIndex* pindexBestKnownBlock{nullptr};
     382                 :            :     //! The hash of the last unknown block this peer has announced.
     383                 :          0 :     uint256 hashLastUnknownBlock{};
     384                 :            :     //! The last full block we both have.
     385                 :          0 :     const CBlockIndex* pindexLastCommonBlock{nullptr};
     386                 :            :     //! The best header we have sent our peer.
     387                 :          0 :     const CBlockIndex* pindexBestHeaderSent{nullptr};
     388                 :            :     //! Length of current-streak of unconnecting headers announcements
     389                 :          0 :     int nUnconnectingHeaders{0};
     390                 :            :     //! Whether we've started headers synchronization with this peer.
     391                 :          0 :     bool fSyncStarted{false};
     392                 :            :     //! When to potentially disconnect peer for stalling headers download
     393                 :          0 :     std::chrono::microseconds m_headers_sync_timeout{0us};
     394                 :            :     //! Since when we're stalling block download progress (in microseconds), or 0.
     395                 :          0 :     std::chrono::microseconds m_stalling_since{0us};
     396                 :            :     std::list<QueuedBlock> vBlocksInFlight;
     397                 :            :     //! When the first entry in vBlocksInFlight started downloading. Don't care when vBlocksInFlight is empty.
     398         [ #  # ]:          0 :     std::chrono::microseconds m_downloading_since{0us};
     399                 :          0 :     int nBlocksInFlight{0};
     400                 :            :     //! Whether we consider this a preferred download peer.
     401                 :          0 :     bool fPreferredDownload{false};
     402                 :            :     //! Whether this peer wants invs or headers (when possible) for block announcements.
     403                 :          0 :     bool fPreferHeaders{false};
     404                 :            :     /** Whether this peer wants invs or cmpctblocks (when possible) for block announcements. */
     405                 :          0 :     bool m_requested_hb_cmpctblocks{false};
     406                 :            :     /** Whether this peer will send us cmpctblocks if we request them. */
     407                 :          0 :     bool m_provides_cmpctblocks{false};
     408                 :            :     //! Whether this peer can give us witnesses
     409                 :          0 :     bool fHaveWitness{false};
     410                 :            : 
     411                 :            :     /** State used to enforce CHAIN_SYNC_TIMEOUT and EXTRA_PEER_CHECK_INTERVAL logic.
     412                 :            :       *
     413                 :            :       * Both are only in effect for outbound, non-manual, non-protected connections.
     414                 :            :       * Any peer protected (m_protect = true) is not chosen for eviction. A peer is
     415                 :            :       * marked as protected if all of these are true:
     416                 :            :       *   - its connection type is IsBlockOnlyConn() == false
     417                 :            :       *   - it gave us a valid connecting header
     418                 :            :       *   - we haven't reached MAX_OUTBOUND_PEERS_TO_PROTECT_FROM_DISCONNECT yet
     419                 :            :       *   - its chain tip has at least as much work as ours
     420                 :            :       *
     421                 :            :       * CHAIN_SYNC_TIMEOUT: if a peer's best known block has less work than our tip,
     422                 :            :       * set a timeout CHAIN_SYNC_TIMEOUT in the future:
     423                 :            :       *   - If at timeout their best known block now has more work than our tip
     424                 :            :       *     when the timeout was set, then either reset the timeout or clear it
     425                 :            :       *     (after comparing against our current tip's work)
     426                 :            :       *   - If at timeout their best known block still has less work than our
     427                 :            :       *     tip did when the timeout was set, then send a getheaders message,
     428                 :            :       *     and set a shorter timeout, HEADERS_RESPONSE_TIME seconds in future.
     429                 :            :       *     If their best known block is still behind when that new timeout is
     430                 :            :       *     reached, disconnect.
     431                 :            :       *
     432                 :            :       * EXTRA_PEER_CHECK_INTERVAL: after each interval, if we have too many outbound peers,
     433                 :            :       * drop the outbound one that least recently announced us a new block.
     434                 :            :       */
     435                 :          0 :     struct ChainSyncTimeoutState {
     436                 :            :         //! A timeout used for checking whether our peer has sufficiently synced
     437                 :          0 :         std::chrono::seconds m_timeout{0s};
     438                 :            :         //! A header with the work we require on our peer's chain
     439                 :          0 :         const CBlockIndex* m_work_header{nullptr};
     440                 :            :         //! After timeout is reached, set to true after sending getheaders
     441                 :          0 :         bool m_sent_getheaders{false};
     442                 :            :         //! Whether this peer is protected from disconnection due to a bad/slow chain
     443                 :          0 :         bool m_protect{false};
     444                 :            :     };
     445                 :            : 
     446                 :            :     ChainSyncTimeoutState m_chain_sync;
     447                 :            : 
     448                 :            :     //! Time of last new block announcement
     449                 :          0 :     int64_t m_last_block_announcement{0};
     450                 :            : 
     451                 :            :     //! Whether this peer is an inbound connection
     452                 :            :     const bool m_is_inbound;

     454                 :            :     //! A rolling bloom filter of all announced tx CInvs to this peer.
     455         [ #  # ]:          0 :     CRollingBloomFilter m_recently_announced_invs = CRollingBloomFilter{INVENTORY_MAX_RECENT_RELAY, 0.000001};
     456                 :            : 
     457         [ #  # ]:          0 :     CNodeState(bool is_inbound) : m_is_inbound(is_inbound) {}
     458                 :            : };

     561                 :            :     /** Register with TxRequestTracker that an INV has been received from a

     569                 :            :

     573                 :            :      *  to time out. */
     574                 :            :     void MaybeSendPing(CNode& node_to, Peer& peer, std::chrono::microseconds now);
     575                 :            :

     578                 :            : 
     579                 :            :     /** Relay (gossip) an address to a few randomly chosen nodes.

     584                 :            :      *                         addresses less.

     586                 :            :     void RelayAddress(NodeId originator, const CAddress& addr, bool fReachable) EXCLUSIVE_LOCKS_REQUIRED(!m_peer_mutex);
     587                 :            : 
     588                 :            :     /** Send `feefilter` message. */
     589                 :            :     void MaybeSendFeefilter(CNode& node, Peer& peer, std::chrono::microseconds current_time);
     590                 :            : 
     591                 :            :     const CChainParams& m_chainparams;
     592                 :            :     CConnman& m_connman;
     593                 :            :     AddrMan& m_addrman;
     594                 :            :     /** Pointer to this node's banman. May be nullptr - check existence before dereferencing. */
     595                 :            :     BanMan* const m_banman;
     596                 :            :     ChainstateManager& m_chainman;
     597                 :            :     CTxMemPool& m_mempool;
     598                 :            :     TxRequestTracker m_txrequest GUARDED_BY(::cs_main);
     599                 :            : 
     600                 :            :     /** The height of the best chain */
     601                 :          0 :     std::atomic<int> m_best_height{-1};
     602                 :            : 
     603                 :            :     /** Next time to check for stale tip */
     604         [ #  # ]:          0 :     std::chrono::seconds m_stale_tip_check_time{0s};
     605                 :            : 
     606                 :            :     /** Whether this node is running in -blocksonly mode */
     607                 :            :     const bool m_ignore_incoming_txs;
     608                 :            : 
     609                 :            :     bool RejectIncomingTxs(const CNode& peer) const;
     610                 :            : 
     611                 :            :     /** Whether we've completed initial sync yet, for determining when to turn
     612                 :            :       * on extra block-relay-only peers. */
     613                 :          0 :     bool m_initial_sync_finished{false};
     614                 :            : 
     615                 :            :     /** Protects m_peer_map. This mutex must not be locked while holding a lock
     616                 :            :      *  on any of the mutexes inside a Peer object. */
     617                 :            :     mutable Mutex m_peer_mutex;
     618                 :            :     /**
     619                 :            :      * Map of all Peer objects, keyed by peer id. This map is protected
     620                 :            :      * by the m_peer_mutex. Once a shared pointer reference is
     621                 :            :      * taken, the lock may be released. Individual fields are protected by
     622                 :            :      * their own locks.
     623                 :            :      */
     624                 :            :     std::map<NodeId, PeerRef> m_peer_map GUARDED_BY(m_peer_mutex);
     625                 :            : 
     626                 :            :     /** Map maintaining per-node state. */
     627                 :            :     std::map<NodeId, CNodeState> m_node_states GUARDED_BY(cs_main);
     628                 :            : 
     629                 :            :     /** Get a pointer to a const CNodeState, used when not mutating the CNodeState object. */
     630                 :            :     const CNodeState* State(NodeId pnode) const EXCLUSIVE_LOCKS_REQUIRED(cs_main);
     631                 :            :     /** Get a pointer to a mutable CNodeState. */
     632                 :            :     CNodeState* State(NodeId pnode) EXCLUSIVE_LOCKS_REQUIRED(cs_main);
     633                 :            : 
     634                 :            :     uint32_t GetFetchFlags(const CNode& pfrom) const EXCLUSIVE_LOCKS_REQUIRED(cs_main);
     635                 :            : 
     636         [ #  # ]:          0 :     std::atomic<std::chrono::microseconds> m_next_inv_to_inbounds{0us};
     637                 :            : 
     638                 :            :     /** Number of nodes with fSyncStarted. */
     639                 :          0 :     int nSyncStarted GUARDED_BY(cs_main) = 0;
     640                 :            : 
     641                 :            :     /**
     642                 :            :      * Sources of received blocks, saved to be able punish them when processing
     643                 :            :      * happens afterwards.
     644                 :            :      * Set mapBlockSource[hash].second to false if the node should not be
     645                 :            :      * punished if the block is invalid.
     646                 :            :      */
     647                 :            :     std::map<uint256, std::pair<NodeId, bool>> mapBlockSource GUARDED_BY(cs_main);
     648                 :            : 
     649                 :            :     /** Number of peers with wtxid relay. */
     650                 :          0 :     std::atomic<int> m_wtxid_relay_peers{0};
     651                 :            : 
     652                 :            :     /** Number of outbound peers with m_chain_sync.m_protect. */
     653                 :          0 :     int m_outbound_peers_with_protect_from_disconnect GUARDED_BY(cs_main) = 0;
     654                 :            : 
     655                 :            :     /** Number of preferable block download peers. */
     656                 :          0 :     int m_num_preferred_download_peers GUARDED_BY(cs_main){0};
     657                 :            : 
     658                 :            :     bool AlreadyHaveTx(const GenTxid& gtxid)
     659                 :            :         EXCLUSIVE_LOCKS_REQUIRED(cs_main, !m_recent_confirmed_transactions_mutex);
     660                 :            : 
     661                 :            :     /**
     662                 :            :      * Filter for transactions that were recently rejected by the mempool.
     663                 :            :      * These are not rerequested until the chain tip changes, at which point
     664                 :            :      * the entire filter is reset.
     665                 :            :      *
     666                 :            :      * Without this filter we'd be re-requesting txs from each of our peers,
     667                 :            :      * increasing bandwidth consumption considerably. For instance, with 100
     668                 :            :      * peers, half of which relay a tx we don't accept, that might be a 50x
     669                 :            :      * bandwidth increase. A flooding attacker attempting to roll-over the
     670                 :            :      * filter using minimum-sized, 60byte, transactions might manage to send
     671                 :            :      * 1000/sec if we have fast peers, so we pick 120,000 to give our peers a
     672                 :            :      * two minute window to send invs to us.
     673                 :            :      *
     674                 :            :      * Decreasing the false positive rate is fairly cheap, so we pick one in a
     675                 :            :      * million to make it highly unlikely for users to have issues with this
     676                 :            :      * filter.
     677                 :            :      *
     678                 :            :      * We typically only add wtxids to this filter. For non-segwit
     679                 :            :      * transactions, the txid == wtxid, so this only prevents us from
     680                 :            :      * re-downloading non-segwit transactions when communicating with
     681                 :            :      * non-wtxidrelay peers -- which is important for avoiding malleation
     682                 :            :      * attacks that could otherwise interfere with transaction relay from
     683                 :            :      * non-wtxidrelay peers. For communicating with wtxidrelay peers, having
     684                 :            :      * the reject filter store wtxids is exactly what we want to avoid
     685                 :            :      * redownload of a rejected transaction.
     686                 :            :      *
     687                 :            :      * In cases where we can tell that a segwit transaction will fail
     688                 :            :      * validation no matter the witness, we may add the txid of such
     689                 :            :      * transaction to the filter as well. This can be helpful when
     690                 :            :      * communicating with txid-relay peers or if we were to otherwise fetch a
     691                 :            :      * transaction via txid (eg in our orphan handling).
     692                 :            :      *
     693                 :            :      * Memory used: 1.3 MB
     694                 :            :      */
     695         [ #  # ]:          0 :     CRollingBloomFilter m_recent_rejects GUARDED_BY(::cs_main){120'000, 0.000'001};
     696                 :            :     uint256 hashRecentRejectsChainTip GUARDED_BY(cs_main);
     697                 :            : 
     698                 :            :     /*
     699                 :            :      * Filter for transactions that have been recently confirmed.
     700                 :            :      * We use this to avoid requesting transactions that have already been
     701                 :            :      * confirnmed.
     702                 :            :      *
     703                 :            :      * Blocks don't typically have more than 4000 transactions, so this should
     704                 :            :      * be at least six blocks (~1 hr) worth of transactions that we can store,
     705                 :            :      * inserting both a txid and wtxid for every observed transaction.
     706                 :            :      * If the number of transactions appearing in a block goes up, or if we are
     707                 :            :      * seeing getdata requests more than an hour after initial announcement, we
     708                 :            :      * can increase this number.
     709                 :            :      * The false positive rate of 1/1M should come out to less than 1
     710                 :            :      * transaction per day that would be inadvertently ignored (which is the
     711                 :            :      * same probability that we have in the reject filter).
     712                 :            :      */
     713                 :            :     Mutex m_recent_confirmed_transactions_mutex;
     714         [ #  # ]:          0 :     CRollingBloomFilter m_recent_confirmed_transactions GUARDED_BY(m_recent_confirmed_transactions_mutex){48'000, 0.000'001};
     715                 :            : 
     716                 :            :     /**
     717                 :            :      * For sending `inv`s to inbound peers, we use a single (exponentially
     718                 :            :      * distributed) timer for all peers. If we used a separate timer for each
     719                 :            :      * peer, a spy node could make multiple inbound connections to us to
     720                 :            :      * accurately determine when we received the transaction (and potentially
     721                 :            :      * determine the transaction's origin). */

     932                 :          0 : std::chrono::microseconds PeerManagerImpl::NextInvToInbounds(std::chrono::microseconds now,
     933                 :            :                                                              std::chrono::seconds average_interval)
     934                 :            : {

     936                 :            :         // If this function were called from multiple threads simultaneously
     937                 :            :         // it would possible that both update the next send variable, and return a different result to their caller.
     938                 :            :         // This is not possible in practice as only the net processing thread invokes this function.
     939                 :          0 :         m_next_inv_to_inbounds = GetExponentialRand(now, average_interval);
     940                 :          0 :     }
     941                 :          0 :     return m_next_inv_to_inbounds;

    1010                 :          0 : void PeerManagerImpl::MaybeSetPeerAsAnnouncingHeaderAndIDs(NodeId nodeid)
    1011                 :            : {
    1012                 :          0 :     AssertLockHeld(cs_main);
    1013                 :            : 
    1014                 :            :     // When in -blocksonly mode, never request high-bandwidth mode from peers. Our
    1015                 :            :     // mempool will not contain the transactions necessary to reconstruct the
    1016                 :            :     // compact block.
    1017         [ #  # ]:          0 :     if (m_ignore_incoming_txs) return;
    1018                 :            : 
    1019                 :          0 :     CNodeState* nodestate = State(nodeid);
    1020   [ #  #  #  # ]:          0 :     if (!nodestate || !nodestate->m_provides_cmpctblocks) {
    1021                 :            :         // Don't request compact blocks if the peer has not signalled support
    1022                 :          0 :         return;
    1023                 :            :     }
    1024                 :            : 
    1025                 :          0 :     int num_outbound_hb_peers = 0;
    1026         [ #  # ]:          0 :     for (std::list<NodeId>::iterator it = lNodesAnnouncingHeaderAndIDs.begin(); it != lNodesAnnouncingHeaderAndIDs.end(); it++) {
    1027         [ #  # ]:          0 :         if (*it == nodeid) {
    1028                 :          0 :             lNodesAnnouncingHeaderAndIDs.erase(it);
    1029                 :          0 :             lNodesAnnouncingHeaderAndIDs.push_back(nodeid);
    1030                 :          0 :             return;
    1031                 :            :         }
    1032                 :          0 :         CNodeState *state = State(*it);
    1033   [ #  #  #  # ]:          0 :         if (state != nullptr && !state->m_is_inbound) ++num_outbound_hb_peers;
    1034                 :          0 :     }
    1035         [ #  # ]:          0 :     if (nodestate->m_is_inbound) {

    1037                 :            :         // our last outbound HB peer in the process.
    1038   [ #  #  #  # ]:          0 :         if (lNodesAnnouncingHeaderAndIDs.size() >= 3 && num_outbound_hb_peers == 1) {

    1040   [ #  #  #  # ]:          0 :             if (remove_node != nullptr && !remove_node->m_is_inbound) {

    1042                 :            :                 // doesn't get removed.
    1043                 :          0 :                 std::swap(lNodesAnnouncingHeaderAndIDs.front(), *std::next(lNodesAnnouncingHeaderAndIDs.begin()));
    1044                 :          0 :             }
    1045                 :          0 :         }

    1050                 :            :             // As per BIP152, we only get 3 of our peers to announce
    1051                 :            :             // blocks using compact encodings.

    1120                 :            :         // An unknown block was announced; just assume that the latest one is the best one.
    1121                 :          0 :         state->hashLastUnknownBlock = hash;

    1125                 :          0 : void PeerManagerImpl::FindNextBlocksToDownload(NodeId nodeid, unsigned int count, std::vector<const CBlockIndex*>& vBlocks, NodeId& nodeStaller)
    1126                 :            : {
    1127         [ #  # ]:          0 :     if (count == 0)
    1128                 :          0 :         return;
    1129                 :            : 
    1130                 :          0 :     vBlocks.reserve(vBlocks.size() + count);
    1131                 :          0 :     CNodeState *state = State(nodeid);
    1132         [ #  # ]:          0 :     assert(state != nullptr);
    1133                 :            : 
    1134                 :            :     // Make sure pindexBestKnownBlock is up to date, we'll need it.
    1135                 :          0 :     ProcessBlockAvailability(nodeid);
    1136                 :            : 
    1137   [ #  #  #  #  :          0 :     if (state->pindexBestKnownBlock == nullptr || state->pindexBestKnownBlock->nChainWork < m_chainman.ActiveChain().Tip()->nChainWork || state->pindexBestKnownBlock->nChainWork < nMinimumChainWork) {
                   #  # ]
    1138                 :            :         // This peer has nothing interesting.
    1139                 :          0 :         return;
    1140                 :            :     }
    1141                 :            : 
    1142         [ #  # ]:          0 :     if (state->pindexLastCommonBlock == nullptr) {
    1143                 :            :         // Bootstrap quickly by guessing a parent of our best tip is the forking point.
    1144                 :            :         // Guessing wrong in either direction is not a problem.
    1145                 :          0 :         state->pindexLastCommonBlock = m_chainman.ActiveChain()[std::min(state->pindexBestKnownBlock->nHeight, m_chainman.ActiveChain().Height())];
    1146                 :          0 :     }
    1147                 :            : 
    1148                 :            :     // If the peer reorganized, our previous pindexLastCommonBlock may not be an ancestor
    1149                 :            :     // of its current tip anymore. Go back enough to fix that.
    1150                 :          0 :     state->pindexLastCommonBlock = LastCommonAncestor(state->pindexLastCommonBlock, state->pindexBestKnownBlock);
    1151         [ #  # ]:          0 :     if (state->pindexLastCommonBlock == state->pindexBestKnownBlock)
    1152                 :          0 :         return;
    1153                 :            : 
    1154                 :          0 :     std::vector<const CBlockIndex*> vToFetch;
    1155                 :          0 :     const CBlockIndex *pindexWalk = state->pindexLastCommonBlock;
    1156                 :            :     // Never fetch further than the best block we know the peer has, or more than BLOCK_DOWNLOAD_WINDOW + 1 beyond the last
    1157                 :            :     // linked block we have in common with this peer. The +1 is so we can detect stalling, namely if we would be able to
    1158                 :            :     // download that next block if the window were 1 larger.
    1159                 :          0 :     int nWindowEnd = state->pindexLastCommonBlock->nHeight + BLOCK_DOWNLOAD_WINDOW;
    1160         [ #  # ]:          0 :     int nMaxHeight = std::min<int>(state->pindexBestKnownBlock->nHeight, nWindowEnd + 1);
    1161                 :          0 :     NodeId waitingfor = -1;
    1162         [ #  # ]:          0 :     while (pindexWalk->nHeight < nMaxHeight) {
    1163                 :            :         // Read up to 128 (or more, if more blocks than that are needed) successors of pindexWalk (towards
    1164                 :            :         // pindexBestKnownBlock) into vToFetch. We fetch 128, because CBlockIndex::GetAncestor may be as expensive
    1165                 :            :         // as iterating over ~100 CBlockIndex* entries anyway.
    1166   [ #  #  #  # ]:          0 :         int nToFetch = std::min(nMaxHeight - pindexWalk->nHeight, std::max<int>(count - vBlocks.size(), 128));
    1167         [ #  # ]:          0 :         vToFetch.resize(nToFetch);
    1168         [ #  # ]:          0 :         pindexWalk = state->pindexBestKnownBlock->GetAncestor(pindexWalk->nHeight + nToFetch);
    1169                 :          0 :         vToFetch[nToFetch - 1] = pindexWalk;
    1170         [ #  # ]:          0 :         for (unsigned int i = nToFetch - 1; i > 0; i--) {
    1171                 :          0 :             vToFetch[i - 1] = vToFetch[i]->pprev;
    1172                 :          0 :         }
    1173                 :            : 
    1174                 :            :         // Iterate over those blocks in vToFetch (in forward direction), adding the ones that
    1175                 :            :         // are not yet downloaded and not in flight to vBlocks. In the meantime, update
    1176                 :            :         // pindexLastCommonBlock as long as all ancestors are already downloaded, or if it's
    1177                 :            :         // already part of our chain (and therefore don't need it even if pruned).
    1178         [ #  # ]:          0 :         for (const CBlockIndex* pindex : vToFetch) {
    1179   [ #  #  #  # ]:          0 :             if (!pindex->IsValid(BLOCK_VALID_TREE)) {
    1180                 :            :                 // We consider the chain that this peer is on invalid.
    1181                 :          0 :                 return;
    1182                 :            :             }
    1183   [ #  #  #  #  :          0 :             if (!State(nodeid)->fHaveWitness && DeploymentActiveAt(*pindex, m_chainman, Consensus::DEPLOYMENT_SEGWIT)) {
             #  #  #  # ]
    1184                 :            :                 // We wouldn't download this block or its descendants from this peer.
    1185                 :          0 :                 return;
    1186                 :            :             }
    1187   [ #  #  #  #  :          0 :             if (pindex->nStatus & BLOCK_HAVE_DATA || m_chainman.ActiveChain().Contains(pindex)) {
             #  #  #  # ]
    1188   [ #  #  #  # ]:          0 :                 if (pindex->HaveTxsDownloaded())
    1189                 :          0 :                     state->pindexLastCommonBlock = pindex;
    1190   [ #  #  #  #  :          0 :             } else if (!IsBlockRequested(pindex->GetBlockHash())) {
                   #  # ]
    1191                 :            :                 // The block is not already downloaded, and not yet in flight.
    1192         [ #  # ]:          0 :                 if (pindex->nHeight > nWindowEnd) {
    1193                 :            :                     // We reached the end of the window.
    1194   [ #  #  #  # ]:          0 :                     if (vBlocks.size() == 0 && waitingfor != nodeid) {
    1195                 :            :                         // We aren't able to fetch anything, but we would be if the download window was one larger.
    1196                 :          0 :                         nodeStaller = waitingfor;
    1197                 :          0 :                     }
    1198                 :          0 :                     return;
    1199                 :            :                 }

    1201         [ #  # ]:          0 :                 if (vBlocks.size() == count) {
    1202                 :          0 :                     return;
    1203                 :            :                 }
    1204         [ #  # ]:          0 :             } else if (waitingfor == -1) {
    1205                 :            :                 // This is the first already-in-flight block.
    1206   [ #  #  #  # ]:          0 :                 waitingfor = mapBlocksInFlight[pindex->GetBlockHash()].first;

    1209                 :            :     }

    1214                 :          0 : void PeerManagerImpl::PushNodeVersion(CNode& pnode, const Peer& peer)

    1242                 :          0 : void PeerManagerImpl::AddTxAnnouncement(const CNode& node, const GenTxid& gtxid, std::chrono::microseconds current_time)
    1243                 :            : {
    1244                 :          0 :     AssertLockHeld(::cs_main); // For m_txrequest
    1245                 :          0 :     NodeId nodeid = node.GetId();
    1246   [ #  #  #  # ]:          0 :     if (!node.HasPermission(NetPermissionFlags::Relay) && m_txrequest.Count(nodeid) >= MAX_PEER_TX_ANNOUNCEMENTS) {
    1247                 :            :         // Too many queued announcements from this peer
    1248                 :          0 :         return;
    1249                 :            :     }
    1250                 :          0 :     const CNodeState* state = State(nodeid);
    1251                 :            : 
    1252                 :            :     // Decide the TxRequestTracker parameters for this announcement:
    1253                 :            :     // - "preferred": if fPreferredDownload is set (= outbound, or NetPermissionFlags::NoBan permission)
    1254                 :            :     // - "reqtime": current time plus delays for:
    1255                 :            :     //   - NONPREF_PEER_TX_DELAY for announcements from non-preferred connections
    1256                 :            :     //   - TXID_RELAY_DELAY for txid announcements while wtxid peers are available
    1257                 :            :     //   - OVERLOADED_PEER_TX_DELAY for announcements from peers which have at least
    1258                 :            :     //     MAX_PEER_TX_REQUEST_IN_FLIGHT requests in flight (and don't have NetPermissionFlags::Relay).
    1259                 :          0 :     auto delay{0us};
    1260                 :          0 :     const bool preferred = state->fPreferredDownload;
    1261         [ #  # ]:          0 :     if (!preferred) delay += NONPREF_PEER_TX_DELAY;
    1262   [ #  #  #  # ]:          0 :     if (!gtxid.IsWtxid() && m_wtxid_relay_peers > 0) delay += TXID_RELAY_DELAY;
    1263         [ #  # ]:          0 :     const bool overloaded = !node.HasPermission(NetPermissionFlags::Relay) &&
    1264                 :          0 :         m_txrequest.CountInFlight(nodeid) >= MAX_PEER_TX_REQUEST_IN_FLIGHT;
    1265         [ #  # ]:          0 :     if (overloaded) delay += OVERLOADED_PEER_TX_DELAY;
    1266                 :          0 :     m_txrequest.ReceivedInv(nodeid, gtxid, preferred, current_time + delay);
    1267                 :          0 : }

    1294                 :          0 : void PeerManagerImpl::ReattemptInitialBroadcast(CScheduler& scheduler)
    1295                 :            : {

    1297                 :            : 
    1298         [ #  # ]:          0 :     for (const auto& txid : unbroadcast_txids) {

    1300                 :            :

    1302   [ #  #  #  # ]:          0 :             RelayTransaction(txid, tx->GetWitnessHash());
    1303                 :          0 :         } else {
    1304         [ #  # ]:          0 :             m_mempool.RemoveUnbroadcastTx(txid, true);
    1305                 :            :         }
    1306                 :          0 :     }
    1307                 :            : 
    1308                 :            :     // Schedule next run for 10-15 minutes in the future.
    1309                 :            :     // We add randomness on every cycle to avoid the possibility of P2P fingerprinting.
    1310   [ #  #  #  #  :          0 :     const std::chrono::milliseconds delta = 10min + GetRandMillis(5min);

    1311   [ #  #  #  # ]:          0 :     scheduler.scheduleFromNow([&] { ReattemptInitialBroadcast(scheduler); }, delta);

    1314                 :          0 : void PeerManagerImpl::FinalizeNode(const CNode& node)
    1315                 :            : {
    1316                 :          0 :     NodeId nodeid = node.GetId();
    1317                 :          0 :     int misbehavior{0};
    1318                 :            :     {
    1319                 :          0 :     LOCK(cs_main);
    1320                 :            :     {
    1321                 :            :         // We remove the PeerRef from g_peer_map here, but we don't always
    1322                 :            :         // destruct the Peer. Sometimes another thread is still holding a
    1323                 :            :         // PeerRef, so the refcount is >= 1. Be careful not to do any
    1324                 :            :         // processing here that assumes Peer won't be changed before it's
    1325                 :            :         // destructed.
    1326         [ #  # ]:          0 :         PeerRef peer = RemovePeer(nodeid);
    1327         [ #  # ]:          0 :         assert(peer != nullptr);
    1328   [ #  #  #  # ]:          0 :         misbehavior = WITH_LOCK(peer->m_misbehavior_mutex, return peer->m_misbehavior_score);
    1329                 :          0 :         m_wtxid_relay_peers -= peer->m_wtxid_relay;
    1330         [ #  # ]:          0 :         assert(m_wtxid_relay_peers >= 0);
    1331                 :          0 :     }
    1332         [ #  # ]:          0 :     CNodeState *state = State(nodeid);
    1333         [ #  # ]:          0 :     assert(state != nullptr);
    1334                 :            : 
    1335         [ #  # ]:          0 :     if (state->fSyncStarted)
    1336                 :          0 :         nSyncStarted--;
    1337                 :            : 
    1338         [ #  # ]:          0 :     for (const QueuedBlock& entry : state->vBlocksInFlight) {
    1339   [ #  #  #  # ]:          0 :         mapBlocksInFlight.erase(entry.pindex->GetBlockHash());
    1340                 :            :     }
    1341   [ #  #  #  #  :          0 :     WITH_LOCK(g_cs_orphans, m_orphanage.EraseForPeer(nodeid));
                   #  # ]

    1343                 :          0 :     m_num_preferred_download_peers -= state->fPreferredDownload;

    1345         [ #  # ]:          0 :     assert(m_peers_downloading_from >= 0);

    1348                 :            :

    1350                 :            :

    1352                 :            :         // Do a consistency check after the last peer is removed.
    1353         [ #  # ]:          0 :         assert(mapBlocksInFlight.empty());

    1379                 :          0 : PeerRef PeerManagerImpl::RemovePeer(NodeId id)
    1380                 :            : {
    1381                 :          0 :     PeerRef ret;
    1382   [ #  #  #  # ]:          0 :     LOCK(m_peer_mutex);

    1384         [ #  # ]:          0 :     if (it != m_peer_map.end()) {
    1385                 :          0 :         ret = std::move(it->second);
    1386         [ #  # ]:          0 :         m_peer_map.erase(it);

    1391                 :          0 : bool PeerManagerImpl::GetNodeStateStats(NodeId nodeid, CNodeStateStats& stats) const
    1392                 :            : {
    1393                 :            :     {
    1394                 :          0 :         LOCK(cs_main);
    1395         [ #  # ]:          0 :         const CNodeState* state = State(nodeid);
    1396         [ #  # ]:          0 :         if (state == nullptr)
    1397                 :          0 :             return false;
    1398         [ #  # ]:          0 :         stats.nSyncHeight = state->pindexBestKnownBlock ? state->pindexBestKnownBlock->nHeight : -1;
    1399         [ #  # ]:          0 :         stats.nCommonHeight = state->pindexLastCommonBlock ? state->pindexLastCommonBlock->nHeight : -1;
    1400         [ #  # ]:          0 :         for (const QueuedBlock& queue : state->vBlocksInFlight) {
    1401         [ #  # ]:          0 :             if (queue.pindex)
    1402         [ #  # ]:          0 :                 stats.vHeightInFlight.push_back(queue.pindex->nHeight);
    1403                 :            :         }
    1404      [ #  #  # ]:          0 :     }
    1405                 :            : 
    1406                 :          0 :     PeerRef peer = GetPeerRef(nodeid);
    1407         [ #  # ]:          0 :     if (peer == nullptr) return false;
    1408                 :          0 :     stats.m_starting_height = peer->m_starting_height;
    1409                 :            :     // It is common for nodes with good ping times to suddenly become lagged,
    1410                 :            :     // due to a new block arriving or other large transfer.
    1411                 :            :     // Merely reporting pingtime might fool the caller into thinking the node was still responsive,
    1412                 :            :     // since pingtime does not update until the ping is complete, which might take a while.
    1413                 :            :     // So, if a ping is taking an unusually long time in flight,
    1414                 :            :     // the caller can immediately detect that this is happening.
    1415                 :          0 :     auto ping_wait{0us};
    1416   [ #  #  #  #  :          0 :     if ((0 != peer->m_ping_nonce_sent) && (0 != peer->m_ping_start.load().count())) {
                   #  # ]
    1417   [ #  #  #  # ]:          0 :         ping_wait = GetTime<std::chrono::microseconds>() - peer->m_ping_start.load();
    1418                 :          0 :     }
    1419                 :            : 
    1420   [ #  #  #  # ]:          0 :     if (auto tx_relay = peer->GetTxRelay(); tx_relay != nullptr) {
    1421   [ #  #  #  # ]:          0 :         stats.m_relay_txs = WITH_LOCK(tx_relay->m_bloom_filter_mutex, return tx_relay->m_relay_txs);
    1422                 :          0 :         stats.m_fee_filter_received = tx_relay->m_fee_filter_received.load();
    1423                 :          0 :     } else {
    1424                 :          0 :         stats.m_relay_txs = false;
    1425                 :          0 :         stats.m_fee_filter_received = 0;
    1426                 :            :     }
    1427                 :            : 
    1428                 :          0 :     stats.m_ping_wait = ping_wait;
    1429                 :          0 :     stats.m_addr_processed = peer->m_addr_processed.load();
    1430                 :          0 :     stats.m_addr_rate_limited = peer->m_addr_rate_limited.load();
    1431                 :          0 :     stats.m_addr_relay_enabled = peer->m_addr_relay_enabled.load();
    1432                 :            : 
    1433                 :          0 :     return true;
    1434                 :          0 : }

    1613                 :          0 : void PeerManagerImpl::StartScheduledTasks(CScheduler& scheduler)
    1614                 :            : {
    1615                 :            :     // Stale tip checking and peer eviction are on two different timers, but we
    1616                 :            :     // don't want them to get out of sync due to drift in the scheduler, so we
    1617                 :            :     // combine them in one function and schedule at the quicker (peer-eviction)
    1618                 :            :     // timer.
    1619                 :            :     static_assert(EXTRA_PEER_CHECK_INTERVAL < STALE_CHECK_INTERVAL, "peer eviction timer should be less than stale tip check timer");
    1620   [ #  #  #  # ]:          0 :     scheduler.scheduleEvery([this] { this->CheckForStaleTipAndEvictPeers(); }, std::chrono::seconds{EXTRA_PEER_CHECK_INTERVAL});
    1621                 :            : 
    1622                 :            :     // schedule next run for 10-15 minutes in the future
    1623                 :          0 :     const std::chrono::milliseconds delta = 10min + GetRandMillis(5min);
    1624         [ #  # ]:          0 :     scheduler.scheduleFromNow([&] { ReattemptInitialBroadcast(scheduler); }, delta);
    1625                 :          0 : }

    1638                 :          0 :         LOCK(m_recent_confirmed_transactions_mutex);

    1655                 :          0 : void PeerManagerImpl::BlockDisconnected(const std::shared_ptr<const CBlock> &block, const CBlockIndex* pindex)
    1656                 :            : {
    1657                 :            :     // To avoid relay problems with transactions that were previously
    1658                 :            :     // confirmed, clear our filter of recently confirmed transactions whenever
    1659                 :            :     // there's a reorg.
    1660                 :            :     // This means that in a 1-block reorg (where 1 block is disconnected and
    1661                 :            :     // then another block reconnected), our filter will drop to having only one
    1662                 :            :     // block's worth of transactions in it, but that should be fine, since
    1663                 :            :     // presumably the most common case of relaying a confirmed transaction
    1664                 :            :     // should be just after a new block containing it is found.
    1665                 :          0 :     LOCK(m_recent_confirmed_transactions_mutex);
    1666         [ #  # ]:          0 :     m_recent_confirmed_transactions.reset();
    1667                 :          0 : }
    1668                 :            :

    1718                 :            : /**

    1722                 :          0 : void PeerManagerImpl::UpdatedBlockTip(const CBlockIndex *pindexNew, const CBlockIndex *pindexFork, bool fInitialDownload)
    1723                 :            : {
    1724                 :          0 :     SetBestHeight(pindexNew->nHeight);
    1725                 :          0 :     SetServiceFlagsIBDCache(!fInitialDownload);
    1726                 :            : 
    1727                 :            :     // Don't relay inventory during initial block download.
    1728         [ #  # ]:          0 :     if (fInitialDownload) return;
    1729                 :            : 
    1730                 :            :     // Find the hashes of all blocks that weren't previously in the best chain.
    1731                 :          0 :     std::vector<uint256> vHashes;
    1732                 :          0 :     const CBlockIndex *pindexToAnnounce = pindexNew;
    1733         [ #  # ]:          0 :     while (pindexToAnnounce != pindexFork) {
    1734   [ #  #  #  # ]:          0 :         vHashes.push_back(pindexToAnnounce->GetBlockHash());
    1735                 :          0 :         pindexToAnnounce = pindexToAnnounce->pprev;
    1736         [ #  # ]:          0 :         if (vHashes.size() == MAX_BLOCKS_TO_ANNOUNCE) {
    1737                 :            :             // Limit announcements in case of a huge reorganization.
    1738                 :            :             // Rely on the peer's synchronization mechanism in that case.
    1739                 :          0 :             break;
    1740                 :            :         }
    1741                 :            :     }
    1742                 :            : 
    1743                 :            :     {
    1744   [ #  #  #  # ]:          0 :         LOCK(m_peer_mutex);
    1745         [ #  # ]:          0 :         for (auto& it : m_peer_map) {
    1746                 :          0 :             Peer& peer = *it.second;
    1747   [ #  #  #  # ]:          0 :             LOCK(peer.m_block_inv_mutex);
    1748   [ #  #  #  #  :          0 :             for (const uint256& hash : reverse_iterate(vHashes)) {
          #  #  #  #  #  
             #  #  #  #  
                      # ]
    1749         [ #  # ]:          0 :                 peer.m_blocks_for_headers_relay.push_back(hash);
    1750                 :            :             }
    1751                 :          0 :         }
    1752                 :          0 :     }
    1753                 :            : 
    1754         [ #  # ]:          0 :     m_connman.WakeMessageHandler();
    1755                 :          0 : }
    1756                 :            : 
    1757                 :            : /**
    1758                 :            :  * Handle invalid block rejection and consequent peer discouragement, maintain which
    1759                 :            :  * peers announce compact blocks.
    1760                 :            :  */
    1761                 :          0 : void PeerManagerImpl::BlockChecked(const CBlock& block, const BlockValidationState& state)
    1762                 :            : {
    1763                 :          0 :     LOCK(cs_main);
    1764                 :            : 
    1765         [ #  # ]:          0 :     const uint256 hash(block.GetHash());
    1766         [ #  # ]:          0 :     std::map<uint256, std::pair<NodeId, bool>>::iterator it = mapBlockSource.find(hash);
    1767                 :            : 
    1768                 :            :     // If the block failed validation, we know where it came from and we're still connected
    1769                 :            :     // to that peer, maybe punish.
    1770   [ #  #  #  #  :          0 :     if (state.IsInvalid() &&
                   #  # ]

    1772         [ #  # ]:          0 :         State(it->second.first)) {
    1773   [ #  #  #  # ]:          0 :             MaybePunishNodeForBlock(/*nodeid=*/ it->second.first, state, /*via_compact_block=*/ !it->second.second);
    1774                 :          0 :     }
    1775                 :            :     // Check that:
    1776                 :            :     // 1. The block is valid
    1777                 :            :     // 2. We're not in initial block download

    1779                 :            :     //    the tip yet so we have no way to check this directly here. Instead we
    1780                 :            :     //    just check that there are currently no other blocks in flight.
    1781   [ #  #  #  #  :          0 :     else if (state.IsValid() &&
                   #  # ]

                   #  # ]

    1798                 :          0 : bool PeerManagerImpl::AlreadyHaveTx(const GenTxid& gtxid)

    1801                 :            :         // If the chain tip has changed previously rejected transactions
    1802                 :            :         // might be now valid, e.g. due to a nLockTime'd tx becoming valid,
    1803                 :            :         // or a double-spend. Reset the rejects filter and give those
    1804                 :            :         // txs a second chance.
    1805                 :          0 :         hashRecentRejectsChainTip = m_chainman.ActiveChain().Tip()->GetBlockHash();
    1806                 :          0 :         m_recent_rejects.reset();
    1807                 :          0 :     }

    1832                 :          0 : void PeerManagerImpl::RelayTransaction(const uint256& txid, const uint256& wtxid)

    1837         [ #  # ]:          0 :         auto tx_relay = peer.GetTxRelay();

    1839                 :            :

    1847                 :            : 
    1848                 :          0 : void PeerManagerImpl::RelayAddress(NodeId originator,
    1849                 :            :                                    const CAddress& addr,
    1850                 :            :                                    bool fReachable)
    1851                 :            : {
    1852                 :            :     // We choose the same nodes within a given 24h window (if the list of connected
    1853                 :            :     // nodes does not change) and we don't relay to nodes that already know an
    1854                 :            :     // address. So within 24h we will likely relay a given address once. This is to
    1855                 :            :     // prevent a peer from unjustly giving their address better propagation by sending
    1856                 :            :     // it to us repeatedly.
    1857                 :            : 
    1858   [ #  #  #  # ]:          0 :     if (!fReachable && !addr.IsRelayable()) return;
    1859                 :            : 
    1860                 :            :     // Relay to a limited number of other nodes
    1861                 :            :     // Use deterministic randomness to send to the same nodes for 24 hours
    1862                 :            :     // at a time so the m_addr_knowns of the chosen nodes prevent repeats
    1863                 :          0 :     const uint64_t hash_addr{CServiceHash(0, 0)(addr)};
    1864                 :          0 :     const auto current_time{GetTime<std::chrono::seconds>()};
    1865                 :            :     // Adding address hash makes exact rotation time different per address, while preserving periodicity.
    1866                 :          0 :     const uint64_t time_addr{(static_cast<uint64_t>(count_seconds(current_time)) + hash_addr) / count_seconds(ROTATE_ADDR_RELAY_DEST_INTERVAL)};
    1867                 :          0 :     const CSipHasher hasher{m_connman.GetDeterministicRandomizer(RANDOMIZER_ID_ADDRESS_RELAY)
    1868                 :          0 :                                 .Write(hash_addr)
    1869                 :          0 :                                 .Write(time_addr)};
    1870                 :          0 :     FastRandomContext insecure_rand;
    1871                 :            : 
    1872                 :            :     // Relay reachable addresses to 2 peers. Unreachable addresses are relayed randomly to 1 or 2 peers.
    1873         [ #  # ]:          0 :     unsigned int nRelayNodes = (fReachable || (hasher.Finalize() & 1)) ? 2 : 1;
    1874                 :            : 
    1875                 :          0 :     std::array<std::pair<uint64_t, Peer*>, 2> best{{{0, nullptr}, {0, nullptr}}};
    1876         [ #  # ]:          0 :     assert(nRelayNodes <= best.size());
    1877                 :            : 
    1878                 :          0 :     LOCK(m_peer_mutex);
    1879                 :            : 
    1880         [ #  # ]:          0 :     for (auto& [id, peer] : m_peer_map) {
    1881   [ #  #  #  #  :          0 :         if (peer->m_addr_relay_enabled && id != originator && IsAddrCompatible(*peer, addr)) {
             #  #  #  # ]
    1882   [ #  #  #  #  :          0 :             uint64_t hashKey = CSipHasher(hasher).Write(id).Finalize();
                   #  # ]
    1883         [ #  # ]:          0 :             for (unsigned int i = 0; i < nRelayNodes; i++) {
    1884         [ #  # ]:          0 :                  if (hashKey > best[i].first) {
    1885         [ #  # ]:          0 :                      std::copy(best.begin() + i, best.begin() + nRelayNodes - 1, best.begin() + i + 1);
    1886         [ #  # ]:          0 :                      best[i] = std::make_pair(hashKey, peer.get());
    1887                 :          0 :                      break;
    1888                 :            :                  }
    1889                 :          0 :             }
    1890                 :          0 :         }
    1891                 :            :     };
    1892                 :            : 
    1893   [ #  #  #  # ]:          0 :     for (unsigned int i = 0; i < nRelayNodes && best[i].first != 0; i++) {
    1894         [ #  # ]:          0 :         PushAddress(*best[i].second, addr, insecure_rand);
    1895                 :          0 :     }
    1896                 :          0 : }
    1897                 :            :

    1957                 :          0 :         return;
    1958                 :            :     }

    1960                 :            :     // it's available before trying to send.

    1995                 :          0 :                     sendMerkleBlock = true;

                   #  # ]
    2001                 :            :                 // CMerkleBlock just contains hashes, so also push any transactions in the block the client did not see
    2002                 :            :                 // This avoids hurting performance by pointlessly requiring a round-trip
    2003                 :            :                 // Note that there is currently no way for a node to request any single transactions we didn't send here -
    2004                 :            :                 // they must either disconnect and retry or request the full block.
    2005                 :            :                 // Thus, the protocol spec specified allows for us to provide duplicate txn here,
    2006                 :            :                 // however we MUST always provide at least what the remote peer needs
    2007                 :            :                 typedef std::pair<unsigned int, uint256> PairType;
    2008         [ #  # ]:          0 :                 for (PairType& pair : merkleBlock.vMatchedTxn)
    2009   [ #  #  #  #  :          0 :                     m_connman.PushMessage(&pfrom, msgMaker.Make(SERIALIZE_TRANSACTION_NO_WITNESS, NetMsgType::TX, *pblock->vtx[pair.first]));
                   #  # ]
    2010                 :          0 :             }
    2011                 :            :             // else
    2012                 :            :             // no response

    2015                 :            :             // they won't have a useful mempool to match against a compact block,

    2046                 :          0 : CTransactionRef PeerManagerImpl::FindTxForGetData(const CNode& peer, const GenTxid& gtxid, const std::chrono::seconds mempool_req, const std::chrono::seconds now)

    2049   [ #  #  #  # ]:          0 :     if (txinfo.tx) {
    2050                 :            :         // If a TX could have been INVed in reply to a MEMPOOL request,
    2051                 :            :         // or is older than UNCONDITIONAL_RELAY_DELAY, permit the request
    2052                 :            :         // unconditionally.

    2057                 :            :

    2072                 :            : 
    2073                 :          0 : void PeerManagerImpl::ProcessGetData(CNode& pfrom, Peer& peer, const std::atomic<bool>& interruptMsgProc)
    2074                 :            : {
    2075                 :          0 :     AssertLockNotHeld(cs_main);

    2151                 :            :         // Let the peer know that we didn't find what it asked for, so it doesn't
    2152                 :            :         // have to wait around forever.
    2153                 :            :         // SPV clients care about this message: it's needed when they are
    2154                 :            :         // recursively walking the dependencies of relevant unconfirmed
    2155                 :            :         // transactions. SPV clients want to do that because they want to know
    2156                 :            :         // about (and store and rebroadcast and risk analyze) the dependencies
    2157                 :            :         // of transactions relevant to them, without having to download the
    2158                 :            :         // entire memory pool.
    2159                 :            :         // Also, other nodes can use these messages to automatically request a
    2160                 :            :         // transaction from some other peer that annnounced it, and stop
    2161                 :            :         // waiting for us to respond.
    2162                 :            :         // In normal operation, we often send NOTFOUND messages for parents of
    2163                 :            :         // transactions that we relay; if a peer is missing a parent, they may
    2164                 :            :         // assume we have them and request the parents from us.

    2381                 :            : 
    2382                 :            : /**
    2383                 :            :  * Reconsider orphan transactions after a parent has been accepted to the mempool.
    2384                 :            :  *
    2385                 :            :  * @param[in,out]  orphan_work_set  The set of orphan transactions to reconsider. Generally only one
    2386                 :            :  *                                  orphan will be reconsidered on each call of this function. This set
    2387                 :            :  *                                  may be added to if accepting an orphan causes its children to be
    2388                 :            :  *                                  reconsidered.
    2389                 :            :  */
    2390                 :          0 : void PeerManagerImpl::ProcessOrphanTx(std::set<uint256>& orphan_work_set)
    2391                 :            : {
    2392                 :          0 :     AssertLockHeld(cs_main);
    2393                 :          0 :     AssertLockHeld(g_cs_orphans);

    2395         [ #  # ]:          0 :     while (!orphan_work_set.empty()) {
    2396                 :          0 :         const uint256 orphanHash = *orphan_work_set.begin();
    2397                 :          0 :         orphan_work_set.erase(orphan_work_set.begin());
    2398                 :            :

    2401                 :            : 
    2402   [ #  #  #  # ]:          0 :         const MempoolAcceptResult result = m_chainman.ProcessTransaction(porphanTx);
    2403                 :          0 :         const TxValidationState& state = result.m_state;
    2404                 :            : 
    2405         [ #  # ]:          0 :         if (result.m_result_type == MempoolAcceptResult::ResultType::VALID) {

          #  #  #  #  #

    2411         [ #  # ]:          0 :                 AddToCompactExtraTransactions(removedTx);
    2412                 :            :             }
    2413                 :          0 :             break;
    2414   [ #  #  #  # ]:          0 :         } else if (state.GetResult() != TxValidationResult::TX_MISSING_INPUTS) {
    2415   [ #  #  #  # ]:          0 :             if (state.IsInvalid()) {
    2416   [ #  #  #  #  :          0 :                 LogPrint(BCLog::MEMPOOL, "   invalid orphan tx %s from peer=%d. %s\n",

    2419                 :            :                     state.ToString());

    2421   [ #  #  #  # ]:          0 :                 MaybePunishNodeForTx(from_peer, state);
    2422                 :          0 :             }
    2423                 :            :             // Has inputs but not accepted to mempool
    2424                 :            :             // Probably non-standard or insufficient fee
    2425   [ #  #  #  #  :          0 :             LogPrint(BCLog::MEMPOOL, "   removed orphan tx %s\n", orphanHash.ToString());
          #  #  #  #  #  
                #  #  # ]
    2426   [ #  #  #  # ]:          0 :             if (state.GetResult() != TxValidationResult::TX_WITNESS_STRIPPED) {
    2427                 :            :                 // We can add the wtxid of this transaction to our reject filter.
    2428                 :            :                 // Do not add txids of witness transactions or witness-stripped
    2429                 :            :                 // transactions to the filter, as they can have been malleated;
    2430                 :            :                 // adding such txids to the reject filter would potentially
    2431                 :            :                 // interfere with relay of valid transactions from peers that
    2432                 :            :                 // do not support wtxid-based relay. See
    2433                 :            :                 // https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/issues/8279 for details.
    2434                 :            :                 // We can remove this restriction (and always add wtxids to
    2435                 :            :                 // the filter even for witness stripped transactions) once
    2436                 :            :                 // wtxid-based relay is broadly deployed.
    2437                 :            :                 // See also comments in https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/18044#discussion_r443419034
    2438                 :            :                 // for concerns around weakening security of unupgraded nodes
    2439                 :            :                 // if we start doing this too early.
    2440   [ #  #  #  #  :          0 :                 m_recent_rejects.insert(porphanTx->GetWitnessHash());
             #  #  #  # ]
    2441                 :            :                 // If the transaction failed for TX_INPUTS_NOT_STANDARD,
    2442                 :            :                 // then we know that the witness was irrelevant to the policy
    2443                 :            :                 // failure, since this check depends only on the txid
    2444                 :            :                 // (the scriptPubKey being spent is covered by the txid).
    2445                 :            :                 // Add the txid to the reject filter to prevent repeated
    2446                 :            :                 // processing of this transaction in the event that child
    2447                 :            :                 // transactions are later received (resulting in
    2448                 :            :                 // parent-fetching by txid via the orphan-handling logic).
    2449   [ #  #  #  #  :          0 :                 if (state.GetResult() == TxValidationResult::TX_INPUTS_NOT_STANDARD && porphanTx->GetWitnessHash() != porphanTx->GetHash()) {
          #  #  #  #  #  
             #  #  #  #  
                      # ]
    2450                 :            :                     // We only add the txid if it differs from the wtxid, to
    2451                 :            :                     // avoid wasting entries in the rolling bloom filter.
    2452   [ #  #  #  #  :          0 :                     m_recent_rejects.insert(porphanTx->GetHash());
             #  #  #  # ]
    2453                 :          0 :                 }
    2454                 :          0 :             }
    2455         [ #  # ]:          0 :             m_orphanage.EraseTx(orphanHash);
    2456                 :          0 :             break;
    2457                 :            :         }
    2458   [ #  #  #  # ]:          0 :     }
    2459                 :          0 : }

    3182                 :            : 
    3183                 :            :         // We might have announced the currently-being-connected tip using a
    3184                 :            :         // compact block, which resulted in the peer sending a getblocks
    3185                 :            :         // request, which we would otherwise respond to without the new block.
    3186                 :            :         // To avoid this situation we simply verify that we are on our best
    3187                 :            :         // known chain now. This is super overkill, but we handle it better
    3188                 :            :         // for getheaders requests, and there are no known nodes which support
    3189                 :            :         // compact blocks but still use getblocks to request blocks.

    3274                 :            :         // If an older block is requested (should never happen in practice,
    3275                 :            :         // but can happen in tests) send a block response instead of a
    3276                 :            :         // blocktxn response. Sending a full block response instead of a
    3277                 :            :         // small blocktxn response is preferable in the case where a peer
    3278                 :            :         // might maliciously send lots of getblocktxn requests to trigger
    3279                 :            :         // expensive disk reads, because it will require the peer to
    3280                 :            :         // actually receive all the data read from disk over the network.

    3302                 :            :         }
    3303                 :            : 
    3304   [ #  #  #  # ]:          0 :         LOCK(cs_main);
    3305                 :            : 
    3306                 :            :         // Note that if we were to be on a chain that forks from the checkpointed
    3307                 :            :         // chain, then serving those headers to a peer that has seen the
    3308                 :            :         // checkpointed chain would cause that peer to disconnect us. Requiring
    3309                 :            :         // that our chainwork exceed nMinimumChainWork is a protection against
    3310                 :            :         // being fed a bogus chain when we started up for the first time and
    3311                 :            :         // getting partitioned off the honest network for serving that chain to
    3312                 :            :         // others.
    3313   [ #  #  #  #  :          0 :         if (m_chainman.ActiveTip() == nullptr ||
                   #  # ]
    3314   [ #  #  #  #  :          0 :                 (m_chainman.ActiveTip()->nChainWork < nMinimumChainWork && !pfrom.HasPermission(NetPermissionFlags::Download))) {

    3315   [ #  #  #  #  :          0 :             LogPrint(BCLog::NET, "Ignoring getheaders from peer=%d because active chain has too little work\n", pfrom.GetId());
          #  #  #  #  #  
                #  #  # ]
    3316                 :          0 :             return;
    3317                 :            :         }
    3318                 :            : 
    3319   [ #  #  #  # ]:          0 :         CNodeState *nodestate = State(pfrom.GetId());
    3320                 :          0 :         const CBlockIndex* pindex = nullptr;
    3321   [ #  #  #  # ]:          0 :         if (locator.IsNull())
    3322                 :            :         {
    3323                 :            :             // If locator is null, return the hashStop block

    3352                 :            :         // pindex can be nullptr either if we sent m_chainman.ActiveChain().Tip() OR
    3353                 :            :         // if our peer has m_chainman.ActiveChain().Tip() (and thus we are sending an empty
    3354                 :            :         // headers message). In both cases it's safe to update
    3355                 :            :         // pindexBestHeaderSent to be our tip.
    3356                 :            :         //
    3357                 :            :         // It is important that we simply reset the BestHeaderSent value here,
    3358                 :            :         // and not max(BestHeaderSent, newHeaderSent). We might have announced
    3359                 :            :         // the currently-being-connected tip using a compact block, which
    3360                 :            :         // resulted in the peer sending a headers request, which we respond to
    3361                 :            :         // without the new block. By resetting the BestHeaderSent, we ensure we
    3362                 :            :         // will re-announce the new block via headers (or compact blocks again)
    3363                 :            :         // in the SendMessages logic.
    3364   [ #  #  #  #  :          0 :         nodestate->pindexBestHeaderSent = pindex ? pindex : m_chainman.ActiveChain().Tip();

    3403                 :            : 
    3404                 :            :         // We do the AlreadyHaveTx() check using wtxid, rather than txid - in the
    3405                 :            :         // absence of witness malleation, this is strictly better, because the
    3406                 :            :         // recent rejects filter may contain the wtxid but rarely contains
    3407                 :            :         // the txid of a segwit transaction that has been rejected.
    3408                 :            :         // In the presence of witness malleation, it's possible that by only
    3409                 :            :         // doing the check with wtxid, we could overlook a transaction which
    3410                 :            :         // was confirmed with a different witness, or exists in our mempool
    3411                 :            :         // with a different witness, but this has limited downside:
    3412                 :            :         // mempool validation does its own lookup of whether we have the txid
    3413                 :            :         // already; and an adversary can already relay us old transactions
    3414                 :            :         // (older than our recency filter) if trying to DoS us, without any need

    3509                 :            :                 // regardless of what witness is provided, we will not accept

    3517                 :          0 :         } else {
    3518   [ #  #  #  # ]:          0 :             if (state.GetResult() != TxValidationResult::TX_WITNESS_STRIPPED) {
    3519                 :            :                 // We can add the wtxid of this transaction to our reject filter.
    3520                 :            :                 // Do not add txids of witness transactions or witness-stripped
    3521                 :            :                 // transactions to the filter, as they can have been malleated;
    3522                 :            :                 // adding such txids to the reject filter would potentially
    3523                 :            :                 // interfere with relay of valid transactions from peers that
    3524                 :            :                 // do not support wtxid-based relay. See
    3525                 :            :                 // https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/issues/8279 for details.
    3526                 :            :                 // We can remove this restriction (and always add wtxids to
    3527                 :            :                 // the filter even for witness stripped transactions) once
    3528                 :            :                 // wtxid-based relay is broadly deployed.
    3529                 :            :                 // See also comments in https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/18044#discussion_r443419034
    3530                 :            :                 // for concerns around weakening security of unupgraded nodes
    3531                 :            :                 // if we start doing this too early.

    3537                 :            :                 // (the scriptPubKey being spent is covered by the txid).
    3538                 :            :                 // Add the txid to the reject filter to prevent repeated
    3539                 :            :                 // processing of this transaction in the event that child

    3541                 :            :                 // parent-fetching by txid via the orphan-handling logic).
